text: I'm currently reading a great book called 'Programming Collective Intelligence' by Toby Segaran (which i highly recommend)
The code examples are all written in Python, and as I have already learnt one new language this year (graduating from VB.net to C#) i'm not keen to jump on another learning curve.
This leaves my with the issue of translating the python examples into C#.
Question is:  How critical is it that the code stay in python?
Are there thing in python that I can't do in a normal managed statically typed language?
